bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, January 8, 1951

div1.p: Hench informs Siler that he is pleased to accept the vice-presidency of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. Hench discusses the recent deaths of Kean and Moran.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, January 8, 1951
div1.opener:
January 8, 1951
Colonel J. F. Siler
2220-20th Street N. W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
The family and I have just returned
from Stockholm. I am trying to conquer a small
mountain of accumulated correspondence. I
have your letter of December 20 telling me of the
meeting of the Board of Managers of the Walter
Reed Memorial Association. I am indeed sorry
I was not in attendance. I shall try to get
to the meeting next fall. I am glad to ac-
cept the office of Vice-President of the Board
of Managers.

I feel quite lost at the absence of
General Kean. He was a very wonderful man.
I am so sorry also that Johnny Moran has passed
away.

I shall be glad to review the minutes
of the meeting and will probably have some
thoughts to write to you after doing so.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
